title: Strengthening Software Development Practical Competencies: Instructional Design for Wilcoxon Rank-Sum Test Education Based on the MACH Model

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: It can explain the principles of the Wilcoxon rank-sum test using the four components of the MACH model (Methods, Analogies, Context, How)
It can interpret results from applying the Wilcoxon rank-sum test by analyzing real-world medical/technical data cases
Even in resource-constrained technical environments, it can simulate test procedures and visually represent results using mobile apps

During a mid-term course (4 weeks), learners analyze two real IT project cases, write a 5-page report structured in three stages (problem definition → technical solution → implementation plan), and achieve over 80% of the criteria in peer evaluation and instructor feedback after a 10-minute presentation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
